content: chinga la migra this is a very basic pattern charted only it can be slightly adjusted by increasing or decreasing the skulls repeat 16 stitches you could also turn it into a beanie pretty easily it s got some very long floats like 60 stitches… but you re out there protesting and giving ice hell floats are nothing to a badass like you or you could break the yarn and add the contrasting color back in when the pattern repeat starts again your pick you re still a badass chinga la migra fuck ice row 18/19 have the longest floats skill level advanced beginner size adult medium/large one size but can be adjusted yarn fingering weight yarn in two contrasting colors minimal amount needed -maybe 75-100 yards needles & notions size 2 2 75mm 16 circular knitting needles stitch markers fingering weight yarn 1 chinga la migra terms k - knit p - purl kfb - knit into front and back of stitch increases by 1 k2tog - knit 2 stitches together decreases by 1 pattern instructions cast on 150 stitches using long-tail cast on or other stretchy cast on of your choice repeat instructions between * * to end of round row 1 *k1 p1* row 2 *k1 p1* row 3 *k1 p1* row 4 *k1 p1* row 5 *knit 24 kfb* you ll have 156 stitches at the end of this round begin chart notes on row 6 of the chart - this is a plain row to get things in order i would place my stitch markers like this knit 20 place x3 then knit 16 place marker to end of round i place my stitch markers like this because the phrase is distributed btween columns 1-64 and the rest of the pattern is a 16 column repeat but that s just my suggestion you can live dangerously without stitch markers too or place them in a way that makes sense to you there s a chart included that doesn t have stitch marker placement on it in case that s how you roll row 32 *knit 24 k2tog* you ll have decreased back down to 150 stitches after this round row 33 *k1 p1* row 34 *k1 p1* row 35 *k1 p1* row 36 *k1 p1* bind off using stretch bind off i prefer the icelandic bind off block -
